physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Eutrophic boy born at term with blindness and bilateral cryptorchidism; seizures and jaundice at birth; central hypothyroidism at age 5; mild facial abnormalities and normal stature at age 35; endocrine tests showed somatotroph, corticotroph, and gonadotroph deficits; MRI revealed partial intrasellar arachnoidocele, hypoplastic anterior pituitary, ectopic posterior pituitary lobe, absent pituitary stalk, and thin anterior corpus callosum.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Endocrine status changed over time with the development of central hypothyroidism at age 5 and deficits in somatotroph, corticotroph, and gonadotroph hormones.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypoglycemic seizures and jaundice; short stature (-2.5 SD score); endocrine investigation revealed GH deficiency and TSH deficiency; MRI showed anterior pituitary hypoplasia and lack of posterior pituitary signal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Acted upon by hormonal supplementation as conditions progressed; ACTH deficiency and hypogonadotroph hypogonadism diagnosed at 23 months and 14 years, respectively.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Short stature (-2.5 SD score), microphallus, hypoglycemia; required neonatal intensive care due to interventricular communication and hypoglycemic seizures; hormonal investigation revealed complete GH and TSH deficits.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptomatic corticotroph and gonadotroph deficiencies diagnosed at pubertal age; MRI showed hypoplastic anterior pituitary, ectopic posterior pituitary, and interrupted pituitary stalk.
